title: Automated Customer Onboarding
description: Automates the customer onboarding process, including identity verification, account creation, payment setup, and welcome email sending. Includes error handling with ServiceNow ticket creation.

steps.description: Verifies the customer's identity against government databases using the provided identity documents.
steps.tool: Third-party Identity Verification Service (simulated, requires integration)
access_requirements: API Access to Identity Verification Service
steps.automation_details: The automation will send customer data and identity documents to the third-party identity verification service via API. It will then wait for a response indicating verification success or failure.

steps.description: Creates a user account in Azure Active Directory for the new customer.
access_requirements: Global Administrator Role in Azure AD
steps.automation_details: Using the Microsoft Graph API or Azure AD PowerShell module, the automation will create a new user account in Azure AD with the information provided in the registration form. A temporary password will be generated and sent to the customer via email (handled in a later step).
starting_points: Successful identity verification or manual approval

steps.description: Sets up payment processing for the customer through Fiserv.
access_requirements: Access to Fiserv Customer Management API
steps.automation_details: The automation will use the Fiserv API to create a new customer profile and set up payment processing based on the customer's preferred payment method. This may involve tokenizing credit card information or setting up ACH payments.

steps.description: Sends a welcome email to the customer with their account details and instructions on how to get started.
steps.tool: Email Service (e.g., SendGrid, Azure Communication Services)
steps.automation_details: The automation will use an email service API to send a welcome email to the customer's registered email address. The email will contain their username, a temporary password (which they will be prompted to change), and links to relevant resources.

steps.step_name: Error Handling and ServiceNow Ticket Creation
steps.description: If any step fails, create a ServiceNow ticket for manual verification and resolution.
steps.automation_details: Each step will include error handling. If an error occurs, the automation will create a ServiceNow ticket with details about the error, the customer's information, and the failed step. The ticket will be assigned to the appropriate team for manual review and resolution. A Slack notification will be sent to the on-call team.
